title.narrative: APL on Strengthening Regional Cooperation For Wildlife Protection in Asia

description.narrative: The project aims to assist the participating governments to build or enhance shared capacity, institutions, knowledge andincentivesto collaborate in tackling illegal wildlife trade and other select regional conservation threats to habitats in borderareas.

participating-org.narrative: Department of National Parks and Wildlife Conservation
Economic Relations Division, Ministry of Finance

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, Paragraph 1 | Description :BD: Establishment of National Project Steering Committee |Due Date :30-Apr-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, Paragraph 1 | Description :NP: Establishment of National Project Steering Committee(NPSC) | Due Date :15-Jun-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, Paragraph 2 | Description :BD: Establishment of Project Implementation Unit within BFDand Project Implementation Committee to be chaired by Chief Conservatorof Forest, consisting of senior officials from BFD. | DueDate :15-May-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, Paragraph 2 | Description :NP: Establishment of National Project Management Committeewithin NPSC | Due Date :15-Jun-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, Paragraphs 3, 4 and 5 | Description :NP: Appointment of NTNC as PCU; staffing of PCU;staff retention until project completion/6 months of closing; retention of PCU staff who benefit from international training perCivil Service Act | Due Date :05-Sep-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 1 (b) (i) | Description :BD: Prior to commencement of any works under theproject, the Borrower must implement applicable RAP or IPDP in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 1 (b) (i) | Description :NP: Prior to commencement of any works under theproject, the Borrower must implement applicable RAP or IPDP in a manner satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 1 (b) (ii) | Description :BD: If any modification or finalisation of anyactivity design or implementation gives rise to Displaced persons, Borrower shall implement a RAP and/or IPDP satisfactory to theAssociation. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 1 (b) (ii) | Description :NP: If any modification or finalisation of anyactivity design or implementation gives rise to Displaced persons, the Borrower shall implement a RAP and/or IPDP satisfactory tothe Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 2 | Description :BD: Application of Environmental and Social ManagementFramework (ESMF) and Environmental Management Plans (EMPs) | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraph 2 | Description :NP: Application of Environmental and Social ManagementFramework (ESMF) and Environmental Management Plans (EMPs) | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraphs 3 and 4 | Description :BD: Monitor implementation of ESMF, EMPs, RAPs, RPF,SIA & IPDS & submission of semi-annual M&E reports. Obtain prior concurrence for any modification/waiver of safeguard instruments.| Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. C, Paragraphs 3 and 4 | Description :NP: Monitor the implementation of EMPs, RAPs, RPF,SIA & IPDS & submission of semi-annual M&E reports. Obtain prior concurrence forany modification/waiver of safeguard instruments. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV B, Paragraph 1 | Description :NP: The Recipient has entered into the MOU with NTNC, inform and substance satisfactory to the Association (Condition of disbursement) | Due Date :05-Sep-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV. B, Paragraph 1 | Description :NP: Preparation and adoption of the Operational Manual inform and substance satisfactory to the Association (Condition of disbursement) | Due Date :30-Dec-2011

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV. B. Paragraph 1 | Description :BD: Preparation and adoption of the Operational Manual inform and substance satisfactory to the Association (Condition of disbursement) | Due Date :30-Dec-2011

title.narrative: Bangladesh Component 1: Indicator 4: Number of training modules developed and delivered by the Wildlife Center
Bangladesh Component 2: Indicator 3: Number of national parks with an ecotourism plan.
Bangladesh Component 3: Indicator 2: Development and implementation of project communication plan
Nepal Comp 3 Ind 1: Effective project coordination among participating countries at each regional thematic meeting.

actual.value: 3 meetings were conducted with all countries coordinating and participating

title.narrative: Bangladesh Component 3: Indicator 1: Effective project coordination among participating countries at each regional thematic meeting.
Regional 2: Number of thematic meetings on wildlife crime and trans-boundary conservation issues among participating and other relevant countries
Regional 1: Number of agreed research programs for regional wildlife management developed among participating countries.
Nepal Comp 2: Ind. 4: A replication strategy developed with action plan for mitigating human elephant conflict.

actual.value: A strategy and action plan are developed

title.narrative: Nepal Comp 1: Indicator 2: Wildlife crime control mechanisms institutionalized and operationalized with capacity for forensic, legal support, and wildlife crime data access and collection.
Bangladesh Component 1: Indicator I: New draft Wildlife Conservation Act giving more powers to the Wildlife Circle approved by Parliament

target.value: Yr 2 - 100%. The target has been achieved.

actual.value: Completed. Approved by Parliament on July10, 2012.

title.narrative: Nepal Comp 1: Indicator 3: Legislation for effective compliance of CITES established.

actual.value: Legislation to address shortcomings in Nepals ability to fulfill obligations under CITIES has been drafted but has not yet receivedparliamentary approval.

title.narrative: PDO 1: A regional mechanism is developed and operational for addressing illegal wildlife trade and other conservation threats

target.value: SAWEN statute drafted, adopted and one annual meeting held after statute approval.

actual.value: Target AchievedThree annual meetings have been held.

title.narrative: Nepal Comp 2: Ind 3: A ranging model developed based on research information for elephant conservation to reduce conflict with humans.

actual.value: The Window 2 sub-projects include: (i) community based human-elephant conflict management in Jhapa District; (ii) improvingmanagement of Bardia National Park through habitat and human wildlife conflict management. Models are being developed based on theexperiences of these sub-projects, final product will be available prior to the end of the project.

title.narrative: Nepal Comp 2. Indicator 5: An ecotourism plan for Banke National Park developed.
PDO 5: Number of activities contributing to tiger conservation.
Nepal Comp 2: Indicator 1: Number of pilot projects designed and implemented to improve protection and conservation of key flagshipspecies.
Bangladesh Component 1: Indicator 5: Number of BFD staff trained in wildlife crime and/or conservation.
PDO 4: Number of implemented pilot initiatives that address trans-boundary wildlife issues.
Bangladesh Component 2: Indicator 1: Number of flagship species for which breeding habitats have been identified in targeted areas.
PDO 3: Wildlife crime control institutions established in the three participating countries.
Nepal Comp 1: Indicator 4: Number of staff trained in state of the art tools on wildlife conservation.
PDO 2: Number of agreed knowledge products developed and shared among SAWEN countries on wildlife crime and/or wildlife conservation.
Nepal Comp 2: Ind 2: Number of models developed for more effective wildlife management.
Bangldsh Comp 2: Indicator 2: Number of species conservation pilot plans developed for more effective wildlife management.
Bangladesh Component 1: Indicator 2: Number of staff added to the Wildlife Circle and who have been trained on enforcement and wildlife crime control.

baseline.value: Inadequate capacity to respond to wildlife crimes

title.narrative: Nepal Comp 1: Indicator 1: Implementation challenges of key policy and legislation identified.

baseline.value: Nepal currently has -National Parks and Wildlife conservation Act, Forest Act and Forest rules

target.value: Updated policies and regulations fully operational.

actual.value: Completed. These policies were reviewed. The key constraint identified was weak implementation rather than policy shortcomings.

title.narrative: Bangladesh Component 1: Indicator 3: Establishment and Operationalizing of Wildlife Crime Control Unit (WCCU) with at least forensic section, legal support arm and wildlife crime bank

baseline.value: No wildlife crime control agency at present

target.value: WCCU fully operational.Operation of forensic and legal units started.Wild-life crime bank fully operational.

actual.value: WCCU fully operational Operation of forensic and legal units started

title.narrative: Areas brought under enhanced biodiversity protection (ha)
Areas brought under enhanced biodiversity protection (ha)
